title: Kinetic Energy Change From Force at an Angle

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is sliding with an initial speed <math alttext="v sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> along a horizontal surface with negligible friction. A constant force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is exerted on the object at an upward angle of <math alttext="60 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>60</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> from the horizontal, causing the object to speed up. If the block remains in contact with the floor, what is the change in the block’s kinetic energy as it moves a horizontal distance <math alttext="delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mtext></mtext><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half F sub A, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub A, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half M, times v sub i, end subscript, squared, plus one half F sub A, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>M</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half M, times v sub i, end subscript, squared, plus F sub A, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>M</mi><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one half F sub A, times delta x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
